radiographic_examinations.findings: Minimal bilateral lower lobe dependent atelectasis; extensive wall thickening involving the cecum and proximal-to-mid ascending colon with surrounding fat stranding, possibly secondary to diverticulitis with mircoperforation versus colitis; terminal ileum markedly thickened; large bladder diverticulum arising from the left posterolateral aspect of the bladder; mild splenomegaly; stable gynecomastia.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Compared to CT from ___, there is stable gynecomastia.
